lead_paragraph: CLEMENT--Joan Susan. (1953-2016) died on April 2 after a long illness with Multiple Sclerosis. She had been an accomplished pianist having played in halls and on the radio in the United States and Europe. She played Sonata recitals with her father, Paul Clement, who had been a member of the New York Philharmonic and there is a CD of a live concert in the Brooklyn Museum that received many highly favorable reviews. Her first teachers were her mother, Marion Clement, a "passionate amateur pianist", Martin Canin, Bruce Hungerford, with a scholarship to Mannes. She received her BFA at Manhattan Marymount and her MFA at Juilliard where she studied with Josef Raieff. Because of her active and creative participation in discussion groups at the UN and the several concerts she played there she was made an Affiliate of the United Nations. She is much missed by everyone who knew her and her individual view of the world. 1/3
